title: Flights to Jaipur from 3 Major Cities of India (Pooja Shree)
text: By Pooja Shree Jul 30, 2015 The capital city of Rajasthan, Jaipur is endowed with immense natural beauty. Majestic forts and royal palaces belonging to the Rajput era add to the charm of this place. Founded back in the year 1727, it is one of the few planned cities of the country. Most of the buildings here are built by using pink stones or are painted in the same colour; hence, it is also called the Pink City. Amazing man-made wonders, significant historical sites and mesmerising scenic spots, tipped off with the vibrant culture here, make it for a perfect getaway destinations. Many people visit this city on weekends, and due to time constraint often book flights to Jaipur. For people looking forward to explore this city in the coming future, here is a list of services available from major cities of the country. Delhi The administrative capital of India, New Delhi is also one of the major transportation hubs in the country. Most of the international flights make a halt here. As per reports, Indira Gandhi International Airport is the busiest terminal in the country. Similarly, this capital city is well-connected with other parts of the country, owing to its strategic location. As far as Jaipur is concerned, there are more than 70 options are available. Most of the flights scheduled to Jaipur are non-stop services, which take less than an hour to travel across these cities. People looking forward to travel with full-services providers Air India or Jet Airways can choose from four and six daily flights. However, cheap flights to Jaipur can be booked SpiceJet and IndiGo that operate two and three flights between these cities every day. Mumbai Housing glittering offices of the giant conglomerates, Mumbai is the financial capital of the country. People from all across the country as well as world come to Mumbai for business purposes. This is the reason that a number of flight services are offered by carriers to and from Mumbai. More than 85 direct, via and non-stop flights to Jaipur from here are operated every day. It includes services of leading airlines in the country, such as IndiGo, Air India, Jet Airways, GoAir and SpiceJet. The national carrier of India - Air India - offers over 25 flights every day. It includes one non-stop flight that takes around one hour and forty-five minutes to reach its destinations. The rest of the flights include one or two stopovers at Delhi, Bhopal or Lucknow. People who like to choose from a long list of options can book their flights to Jaipur with Jet Airways. It operates more than 50 flights every day between these two cities. Different routes are catered by this airline, but most of the flights take a halt at the Delhi airport. Chennai The capital of Tamil Nadu, Chennai is emerging as a major industrial hub in the country. This city in itself is a popular tourist attraction, but people residing here often plan a vacation in Jaipur for a change. Though the number of services between Chennai and Jaipur is low when compared to above-mentioned cities, travellers still can choose from over 55 options. Travellers looking forward to experience royalty can choose any of the options. About the Author Travellers can book flights to Jaipur from these major cities to take a break from routine life and enjoy a laid back vacation here. Rating:
